snippet: The New York Police Department said officers had urged residents in low-lying neighborhoods of the borough to leave and saved more than 1,100 people trapped in homes.
abstract: New York Police Department says that many officers risked their lives trying to save residents in low-lying neighborhoods on Staten Island who did not heed the call to evacuate as Hurricane Sandy approached; 23 people were killed in Staten Island as a result of the storm, the most of any borough, prompting concerns about the city's evacuation procedures.

byline.original: By KIRK SEMPLE and JOSEPH GOLDSTEIN

lead_paragraph: The New York Police Department said officers had urged residents in low-lying neighborhoods of the borough to leave and saved more than 1,100 people trapped in homes.

headline.seo: New York Police Defend Work on Staten Island Before and During Hurricane Sandy
headline.main: Officers ‘Risked Their Lives’ Making Rescues on Staten Island, Police Say
headline.print_headline: Officers ‘Risked Their Lives’ Making Rescues on Staten Island, Police Say
